designSystem.name: High-Stakes Technical Narrative Design System
designSystem.description: A bold, technical, high-contrast design system for executive/technical audiences. Emphasizes urgency, precision, and action-oriented messaging.

corePhilosophy.visualTone: Dark, technical, militaristic precision with high-energy accents
corePhilosophy.targetAudience: Technical executives, CTOs, VPs of Engineering, founders

backgrounds.usage: Deep, near-black backgrounds for maximum contrast

text.usage: Light text on dark backgrounds for readability

fontFamilies.mono: Geist Mono (or JetBrains Mono, Fira Code)
fontFamilies.usage: Sans for body, mono for technical/code elements

headingStyle.accentPattern: Gradient text on key phrases using bg-clip-text + bg-gradient-to-r

primary.classes: px-8 py-4 bg-gradient-to-r from-amber-500 to-orange-600 text-white font-bold rounded-sm hover:scale-105 transition-transform shadow-xl shadow-amber-500/20

secondary.classes: px-6 py-3 bg-slate-800 text-slate-200 font-bold rounded-sm border border-slate-700 hover:border-amber-500/50 transition-colors

default.classes: bg-slate-900 rounded-2xl p-8 border border-slate-800 hover:border-amber-500/50 transition-all duration-300

elevated.classes: bg-gradient-to-b from-slate-800 to-slate-900 rounded-2xl p-8 border-2 border-amber-500/30 shadow-2xl

interactive.classes: bg-slate-900 rounded-xl p-6 border border-slate-800 hover:border-amber-500 hover:shadow-lg hover:shadow-amber-500/10 transition-all cursor-pointer group

status.classes: inline-flex items-center gap-2 px-4 py-2 rounded-full bg-slate-900 border border-slate-800 text-amber-500 font-bold tracking-wider text-xs uppercase

urgency.classes: bg-amber-500 text-slate-950 text-xs font-bold px-3 py-1 rounded-full

fixed.classes: fixed top-0 left-0 right-0 z-50 bg-slate-950/90 backdrop-blur-md border-b border-slate-900

text.classes: w-full px-4 py-3 bg-slate-900 border border-slate-800 rounded-sm text-slate-200 placeholder:text-slate-500 focus:border-amber-500 focus:outline-none transition-colors

textarea.classes: w-full px-4 py-3 bg-slate-900 border border-slate-800 rounded-sm text-slate-200 placeholder:text-slate-500 focus:border-amber-500 focus:outline-none transition-colors resize-none

heroSection.structure: Full-width section with max-w-7xl container, centered or two-column layout
elements: Massive headline (text-7xl or text-8xl) with gradient accent on key phrase
Optional: Hero image/visual on right side

comparisonLayout.vsBadge: absolute left-1/2 top-1/2 -translate-x-1/2 -translate-y-1/2 z-10 bg-slate-800 text-slate-200 font-bold rounded-full w-12 h-12 flex items-center justify-center border-4 border-slate-950 hidden md:flex
comparisonLayout.badSide: bg-slate-900 border border-red-500/30 with red accents
comparisonLayout.goodSide: bg-slate-900 border border-green-500/30 with green accents

decorative.orb: Absolute positioned div with blur-[100px] bg-amber-500/20 rounded-full
decorative.scanline: bg-gradient-to-b from-transparent via-amber-500/5 to-transparent with animation
decorative.grid: Use external texture URLs with opacity-30 for technical feel

setup: 1. Initialize Next.js 16+ with TypeScript and App Router
3. npm install lucide-react framer-motion clsx tailwind-merge
4. Configure Geist fonts (or similar technical sans/mono fonts)
5. Set up Tailwind config with slate and amber color scales
fileStructure: app/layout.tsx - Root layout with fonts and metadata
app/[route]/page.tsx - Individual pages with 'use client' if using hooks
keyReminders: Use 'use client' directive for components with useState, useEffect, or event handlers
Prefer dark backgrounds (slate-950, slate-900) with light text (slate-200, slate-300)
Use amber-500/orange-600 for all CTAs and interactive elements
Use extrabold fonts for headlines, normal for body
Add selection:bg-amber-500/30 to body for branded text selection
Use rounded-sm for buttons (sharp), rounded-xl/2xl for cards (softer)
Implement hover states on all interactive elements
Use max-w-7xl containers for content width control
Add responsive breakpoints (md:, lg:) for all major layout shifts
